title: How to Draw Mario and Luigi

steps.headline: Draw a circle for the head.
Draw two slightly slanted vertical lines below the circle.
steps.description: These will serve as Luigi's neck.

steps.headline: For Luigi's body, connect a larger and slightly stretched circle below the neck.
Draw a pair of stretched ovals as Luigi's arms.
steps.description: Connect them to where the shoulders should be. Add a circle on the tip of these arms for the hands.

steps.headline: Below the big circle, add another pair of stretched ovals for Luigi's legs and feet.
Draw a U-shape below the circle that represents Luigi's head.
With this chin part completing the whole head outline, draw three slightly curved horizontal lines across the entire head.
Using these three lines as guide lines, draw Luigi's facial details (eyes, large nose, mustache, etc.)
Trace the outline of Luigi's body.
Add details such as his hat, gloves, and clothing.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired.
Draw a circle for the head.
Draw a slightly vertically-stretched copy of this circle.
steps.description: Place this stretched circle within the first circle, with its bottom protruding out the first circle. This combination of circles would be Mario's head.

steps.headline: Draw a copy of the first circle below the stretched circle.
steps.description: This will serve as Mario's body.

steps.headline: Draw a pair of small circles where Mario's shoulders should be.
steps.description: Connect stretched ovals for both circles to serve as his arms. At the end of each of these ovals, add another small circle for Mario's hands.

steps.headline: Draw a pair of stretched circles to serve as Mario's legs and feet.
Across Mario's head part, draw a center vertical line.
steps.description: Draw also a horizontal line across it, intersecting the vertical line at the center. Add a parallel horizontal line just above the first one.

steps.headline: Using these lines as guides, draw Mario's circular nose at the center.
steps.description: Add his eyes, mustache, mouth and eyebrows.

steps.headline: Complete his facial outline.
steps.description: Add his ears and plumber's hat.

steps.headline: Trace the outline of Mario's body and clothing.
Add more detail lines on his hands, ears, eyes and clothing.
Erase unnecessary lines.
steps.description: Don't forget to place the signature letter "M" on his hat.

steps.headline: Thicken the drawing lines.

text: Luigi Draw a circle for the head.  Draw two slightly slanted vertical lines below the circle. These will serve as Luigi's neck. For Luigi's body, connect a larger and slightly stretched circle below the neck.  Draw a pair of stretched ovals as Luigi's arms. Connect them to where the shoulders should be. Add a circle on the tip of these arms for the hands. Below the big circle, add another pair of stretched ovals for Luigi's legs and feet.  Draw a U-shape below the circle that represents Luigi's head. This will be his chin. With this chin part completing the whole head outline, draw three slightly curved horizontal lines across the entire head.  Using these three lines as guide lines, draw Luigi's facial details (eyes, large nose, mustache, etc.)  Trace the outline of Luigi's body.  Add details such as his hat, gloves, and clothing.  Erase unnecessary lines.  Color the drawing as desired.  Mario Draw a circle for the head.  Draw a slightly vertically-stretched copy of this circle. Place this stretched circle within the first circle, with its bottom protruding out the first circle. This combination of circles would be Mario's head. Draw a copy of the first circle below the stretched circle. This will serve as Mario's body. Draw a pair of small circles where Mario's shoulders should be. Connect stretched ovals for both circles to serve as his arms. At the end of each of these ovals, add another small circle for Mario's hands. Draw a pair of stretched circles to serve as Mario's legs and feet.  Across Mario's head part, draw a center vertical line. Draw also a horizontal line across it, intersecting the vertical line at the center. Add a parallel horizontal line just above the first one. Using these lines as guides, draw Mario's circular nose at the center. Add his eyes, mustache, mouth and eyebrows. Complete his facial outline. Add his ears and plumber's hat. Trace the outline of Mario's body and clothing.  Add more detail lines on his hands, ears, eyes and clothing.  Erase unnecessary lines. Don't forget to place the signature letter "M" on his hat. Thicken the drawing lines. Color the drawing as desired.

Draw two slightly slanted vertical lines below the circle.
These will serve as Luigi's neck.
For Luigi's body, connect a larger and slightly stretched circle below the neck.
Draw a pair of stretched ovals as Luigi's arms.
Connect them to where the shoulders should be.
Add a circle on the tip of these arms for the hands.
Below the big circle, add another pair of stretched ovals for Luigi's legs and feet.
Draw a U-shape below the circle that represents Luigi's head.
This will be his chin.
With this chin part completing the whole head outline, draw three slightly curved horizontal lines across the entire head.
Using these three lines as guide lines, draw Luigi's facial details (eyes, large nose, mustache, etc.)
Trace the outline of Luigi's body.
Add details such as his hat, gloves, and clothing.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired.
Mario Draw a circle for the head.
Draw a slightly vertically-stretched copy of this circle.
Place this stretched circle within the first circle, with its bottom protruding out the first circle.
This combination of circles would be Mario's head.
Draw a copy of the first circle below the stretched circle.
This will serve as Mario's body.
Draw a pair of small circles where Mario's shoulders should be.
Connect stretched ovals for both circles to serve as his arms.
At the end of each of these ovals, add another small circle for Mario's hands.
Draw a pair of stretched circles to serve as Mario's legs and feet.
Across Mario's head part, draw a center vertical line.
Draw also a horizontal line across it, intersecting the vertical line at the center.
Add a parallel horizontal line just above the first one.
Using these lines as guides, draw Mario's circular nose at the center.
Add his eyes, mustache, mouth and eyebrows.
Complete his facial outline.
Add his ears and plumber's hat.
Trace the outline of Mario's body and clothing.
Add more detail lines on his hands, ears, eyes and clothing.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Don't forget to place the signature letter "M" on his hat.
Thicken the drawing lines.
Color the drawing as desired.
tyn_section: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
